snippet: When a cubicle is the classroom, who is grading the companies? Research suggests many colleges are ignoring their oversight responsibilities.
abstract: Unpaid internships, which are becoming increasingly common and necessary part of college experience, are economically beneficial to both colleges and businesses but, if unregulated, may not do enough to help students.
lead_paragraph: When a cubicle is the classroom, who is grading the companies? Research suggests many colleges are ignoring their oversight responsibilities.

headline.print_headline: Giving Credit, But Is It Due?
headline.seo: Internships for Credit, Merited or Not
headline.main: Giving Credit, but Is It Due?
